subtitle: Often under-rated, fresh sardines are best cooked simply. The use of fresh herbs brings out the flavour.

method.text: Remove heads from the sardines. Split the fish and carefully take out the bones.
Blend the cheese with the herbs and seasoning.
Spread the open fish with the cheese mixture. Fold over to enclose the filling.
Arrange the fish on a lightly oiled ovenproof serving dish. Brush with the remaining oil.
Cook in the oven for 200°C. Serve, garnished with lime wedges.

title: Herb stuffed sardines
